name: Language Analysis / Programming Aids / MCOS QE

info.description:
Work at the heart of the MATLAB language and on highly visible features to all MATLAB users!  

We support critical parts of the MATLAB language such as core performant data types (string, pattern, dictionary), parsing to IR, and MATLAB classes, as well as features that to make all MATLAB users' lives easier (Code Analyzer and programming aids like tab completion).

projects.title: Performance Test Procedure for MCOS functions

info.description:
Simulink Simulation team is responsible for the main entry points into simulation (sim command, play button, simulation stepper) and the infrastructure to advance simulation while supporting the various runtime features in Simulink. The team is currently focusing on two big projects: creating a framework for distributed simulations (using cloud services) and revamping the Simulink debugging workflows.

The team is also responsible for the core Simulink workflows of input data loading, including inter-process communication, and simulation state save/restore.

This team's work involves design considerations affecting the entire Simulink platform. 
Explore projects with us if you are interested in broad-impact features, software architecture, and/or cloud technologies.

info.description:
The DA Test Frameworks Team develops test tools for Simulink and Code Generation testing workflows. These test tools are based on MATLAB Testing Framework (MUnit) and are primarily written in MATLAB. We also develop exploratory testing and reporting infrastructure widely known as Feature Based tests (FBT) in MathWorks. The FBT infrastructure is hosted in Git and spans MATLAB, GoLang and JavaScript technologies. We are also exploring GenAI and Cody for some of the CDA focused test generation workflows. 

Here are some major test tools owned by the team:
https://mathworks.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DATF/pages/42556220/simulinktest.TestCase
https://mathworks.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DATF/pages/42554951/SimulationControlTester
https://mathworks.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DATF/pages/42555002/MATLABCoderTestCase
https://mathworks.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DATF/pages/42566005/AST-Based+Code+Content+Verification+tool+ASTVerifier
https://mathworks.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DATF/pages/42561451/FBT+Resource+Center

projects.title: AST Visualizer Nodes To Source Code link

info.description:
Our team provides critical support to qualify our private cloud offerings which are foundational to the SaaS north-star vision. Private Cloud Foundation provides the infrastructure to develop, deploy, and productize MATLAB Online and multiple other existing and future Online Products to the cloud for our customers to use with their own secure, private environment.

We will need help to develop new cutting-edge tooling and automation to qualify our products and provide support to downstream teams who are working to support their products in the private cloud.

You will learn about microservices, DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, Go, Kubernetes, containers, functional and non-functional testing, and more.

projects.title: Enhance CI/CD pipeline for Authnz (authorization and authentication) microservice

info.description: Our team is responsible for the product security operations for all our desktop, mobile, and online products. We work on Vulnerability Management, Static analysis, dynamic analysis, software composition analysis (3P vulnerabilities), MathWorks Bug Bounty program, Security research, tooling, analytics, performing penetration testing and security assessments of high-risk products and external researcher communication.

projects.title: Comparative Evaluation of Wiz and Xray CVE Scanning

info.description:
Our team owns the testing and quality of:
1. SDI (Simulation Data Inspector), which is used to visualize and compare different kinds of data.
2. RAP (record and playback blocks) are sink and source blocks. Record block is used to record data to workspace and file, whereas playback block is used to load the input data for simulation.
3. HDL code (VHDL, Verilog, and SystemVerilog) generation support for Simulink Models
4. Enhancing the HDL infrastructure, model generation, readability, and performance issues

projects.title: Write a C++ unit test for HDL Coder using the latest Pirfect test infrastructure.

info.description: The Data Persistence Team develops key infrastructure used by development teams across the organization such as MATLAB Data Array (a new C++ API which can be used to represent all MATLAB datatypes), Settings (which is used by C++, MATLAB and Javascript developers to store and retrieve their configuration data), Protobuf/JSON serialization and MAT-Files.

projects.title: C++ APIs for v7.3 MAT-Files
Adding Struct Support To MT-File Objects

info.description:
The Simulink Real-Time QE team at MathWorks collaborates closely with the Development team to ensure the quality and reliability of the software. The Development team deploys Simulink models to real-time hardware, and develops high-performance instrumentation for handling big data on a customized, real-time Linux kernel.

We work in conjunction with the Development team to test and validate the functionality, performance, and compatibility of Simulink Real-Time and Simulink Desktop Real-Time. We maintain automated test suites, execute test cases, and analyze results to identify and report any issues or bugs. This collaborative effort ensures the stability, reliability, and performance of Simulink Real-Time, enabling efficient prototyping and simulation of real-time systems while handling large amounts of data.

Additionally, working with our team provides the opportunity to collaborate with cutting-edge hardware such as Speedgoat targets. If you have a passion for hardware or embedded systems, you'll find a perfect fit here. You'll have the chance to actively engage in exciting projects, leveraging these cool technologies and contributing to the development of real-time systems in various industries.

info.description:
The Globalization department is responsible for translation of our software, documentation, training, and marketing materials for MATLAB and Simulink. We also ensure that our software is capable of working correctly with multilingual data. Half of our work is to create tools to enable the internationalization and localization of our software. The other part is ensuring that we have high quality translation. We work with Chinese, Japanese, Korean, French, Italian, German, and Spanish.

English is not the first language for many of our customers, and potential customers. We believe that localizing our content – documentation, software, online training content, marketing material, videos, etc. – will help our customers evaluate a product, complete a transaction such as downloading or purchasing, learn to use our products, or troubleshoot an issue.

projects.title: Constructing a Testing Pipeline for Prompts

info.description: Release Engineering provides development support services and resources to deliver MathWorks products on time and to provide predictability to our development process. The ongoing purpose of the Release Engineering team is to keep our build, test, and release process running smoothly. This involves managing our integration process, augmenting our build, test and release strategy to meet our product delivery and quality requirements, and developing tools and other resources to streamline our development process.
skills: Debugging, C++, MATLAB, Passion to support Development/Release of our products
learning: Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), Change Management, Git, Continuous Integration (CI), Continuous Deployment (CD), MathWorks Infrastructure

projects.title: Reduction in processing time of Keyword search

info.description: Sandbox Workflows, part of IAT, is an internal team supporting processes and tooling of common Development workflows in the areas of sandbox management (Sandbox Manager), code reviewing (Review Board), exploring and refactoring (Code Search, Sourcegraph, Doxygen) plus AI-assisted coding tools (Sourcegraph Cody). Additionally, we provide tooling for certain UX activities (UX Study Manager) and icon management (Icon ID Catalog, Icon Repository). Our aim is to increase developer productivity by improving the ease of use and reliability of our tools.  To do so, our web applications leverage state of the art and industry standard technologies and frameworks(Linux, Apache, nginx, MySQL/MariaDB, Node.js, TypeScript, React, Next.js, Electron, Solr, Golang), Docker, GenAI.”

projects.title: Add missing unit tests for ONNX operators.

info.description:
The Build and Test (BaT) team is at the forefront of enabling our 3000-strong distributed development organization to seamlessly develop (build) and validate (test) their work. This proprietary CI system offers unparalleled features that surpass any off-the-shelf CI solution, including massively parallelized testing across thousands of hosts, in-depth analysis of build and test failures, automatic reruns of correctable failures, and the capability to silence and re-enable tests automatically, among many others.
The BaT team is composed of highly motivated and intelligent individuals who are dedicated to delivering the best CI experience to MathWorks developers. As part of BaT, you will collaborate closely with developers, buildmadmins, release engineers, and various infrastructure teams to gather requirements and deliver solutions that exceed our customers' expectations.

We are actively working on designing, architecting, and converging onto what our next SCM would look like, and developing infrastructure standards and tools to support this new exciting world. Our vision is to create a seamless and innovative SCM ecosystem that enhances efficiency, scalability, and collaboration across all platforms.
skills: Java, Spring Boot, Java EE, Git, Perforce, JavaScript (ReactJS, ExtJS, NodeJS), Go, MariaDB, Scripting
learning: Java, Spring Boot, Java EE, Git, Perforce, JavaScript (ReactJS, ExtJS, NodeJS), Go, MariaDB, Scripting

info.description:
Our group is responsible for developing a cutting edge and fast growing product for automating verification of Simulink models and code: Simulink Test.

We design, implement, and ship key features to support functional testing of Simulink and Stateflow models.  Our work includes designing new Simulink and Stateflow-derived language constructs, efficient methods of execution and new ways to visualize testing outcomes.

We are expanding our focus to deliver our toolchain on the cloud.

info.description: We develop state of art technology stack to enable scalability for Simulink product family such as Stateflow, Embedded Coder, DSP System Toolbox, etc. Additionally, we develop foundation frameworks to allow DA teams develop their features with highest quality.

projects.title: Convert SLCompBlock Properties with DynamicProperties API

info.description:
Our team support both Simulink Architecture team and Sbtools team. 

Simulink Architecture team works on core infrastructure in Simulink that can benefit many other CDA products. The team's vision is to offer scalable and unit testable architecture in Simulink. QE team works w/ developers closely throughout the whole development cycle, from design review to implementation and testing stage. Together, QE and development teams are making critical contributions toward company's goal of making "Simulink as a Service".

Sbtools team develops sandbox qualification tools that are widely used in CDA teams. QE team actively works on multiple projects to keep the tools in good condition so that the big user groups can do their job efficiently and effectively.
